passages.text: - News/press: CON GY sells OESL (price not disclosed), DHER GY Q2, SWON SW H1- Research: SIE GY OW with €300 PT (scenario analysis on SHL GY stake), French telcos update on SFR debt restructuring given French politics, oil and gas key drivers and Q&A- Today: DHER GY Q2 and 1pm call (webcast), SWON SW H1 and 8am call (webcast), WG/ LN PUSU deadline- JPM Today: JDEP NA Deep-dive call on JPE Peets at 2.30pm UKT/ 9.30am ET hosted by Celine Pannuti (Head of the European Staples & Beverages research team). Sign-up for the call using this link.

- CON GY: Continental announced the sale of its OESL business (hose lines and bearing elements) to Regent for an undisclosed price. The sale is conditional on anti-trust approval. OESL generated ~€1.9B sales in 2024.- DHER GY: Delivery Hero reported Q2 GMV +11% y/y to €12.2B. GMV in Asia improved sequentially to -2% y/y on a 1fl basis (from -7% on 1fl basis in Q1), moving closer towards growth. has reduced their 2025 adj. EBITDA and FCF guidance due to FX headwinds. link- SWON SW: SoftwareOne reported a H1 y/y revenue decline of 5% in constant ccy, with adj. EBITDA margins higher by 0.5% to 23.5% due to their cost reduction program, continued strict cost control and lower extraordinary costs. The integration process of CRAYN began in early July with the appointment of country leaders. Call at 8am UKT. link

- Siemens - The 'new Siemens' is not priced in, OW with PT €300-Phil Buller here With the decade-long conglomerate discount versus peers now all but gone, buying Siemens at this point necessitates confidence that the company can sustainably outgrow earnings and/or warrant a premium valuation versus peers. Our analysis suggests both are probable. In this cross-asset and cross-sector note, we explore the prospects for the Siemens AG (SIE) and Siemens Healthineers AG (SHL) equities under different simplification scenarios ahead of an important December 9 CMD, in addition to assessing the impact this would have on credit metrics. We are moving to an OW (from NR) with a Dec-26 PT of €30 (c30% upside), place the stock on Positive Catalyst Watch into the CMD and add it to our Analyst Focus List.

- Potential structures: The cleanest and most value enhancing scenario for SIE shareholders, and SHL shareholders following an inevitable high degree of volatility, would be a dividend-in-kind of the full SHL holding to SIE shareholders. However, this blue sky scenario would be quite uncharacteristic for Siemens. More probable scenarios would be (A) falling to a sub-50% holding via block placings for buyback purposes, or (B) distributing say 2/3rds of the 73% holding as a dividend-in-kind. In our view, scenario A would fail to placate investors, whereas a variation of scenario B would result in a small-enough minority to improve multiples whilst retaining optionality.
This is Phil's downside/ base case and blue sky SOTP for Siemens:

- French Telecoms - Update on SFR's debt restructuring plans and this week's French political developments- Akhil Dattani here

Overall, we consider SFR's October debt restructuring plans to be on track. The closing of this restructuring process is seen as a pre- requisite to the potential consummation of French Telco consolidation talks; (2) Whilst this week's French political turmoil has seen both Bouygues and Orange's shares trade off \(\sim 5\%\) , we consider this a buying opportunity.
